thread.title: Winter returns a day after record-breaking high temperatures in Toronto | Toronto Star
thread.title_full: Winter returns a day after record-breaking high temperatures in Toronto | Toronto Star

author: Evelyn Kwong Staff Reporter
title: Winter returns a day after record-breaking high temperatures in Toronto | Toronto Star
text:
It’s time to take out the parka, again. In less than 24 hours, the beginning of March has swung from spring-like temperatures back to frigid, wintery conditions.
A battle of the two seasons, Wednesday’s temperature high reached 13.5 C in the afternoon, breaking a 17-year record of 13.2 C set in 2000.
Just half a day later on Thursday, temperatures have dropped to a blistery -7 C, feeling closer to -16 C with strong winds throughout the day. By evening, temperatures will be sitting at a low of -9 C, which is expected to feel much colder with the wind chill.
Keep the winter gear out! The freeze is here to stay for the next couple days, with the coldest temperatures expected to hit the city as we head into the weekend.
Article Continued Below Friday’s forecast reaches a low of -11 C, with a 40 per cent chance of flurries.
Saturday will be another icy day, with temperatures hitting a low of -12 C.
But not to worry, conditions will curve back into the positives by Sunday with a high of 2 C. By Monday and Tuesday, the forecast is expected rise to a high of 9 C.
